pictures.caption: Ice deposits detected in Deuteronilus Mensae

image.caption: This map of a region known as Deuteronilus Mensae, in the northern hemisphere, shows locations of the detected ice deposits in blue. The yellow lines indicate ground tracks of the radar observations from multiple orbits of the spacecraft

thumbnailImage.caption: This map of a region known as Deuteronilus Mensae, in the northern hemisphere, shows locations of the detected ice deposits in blue. The yellow lines indicate ground tracks of the radar observations from multiple orbits of the spacecraft

pictures.caption: Layers of rock exposed near the centre of Gale Crater

image.caption: Layers of rock exposed in the lower portion of a tall mound near the center of Gale Crater on Mars exhibit variations in layer thickness and range between dark and light tones. The crater's mound of layered material is over 4 kilometers (2.4 miles) high, making it more than twice as thick as the stack of rocks exposed in the Grand Canyon on Earth. Gale Crater is approximately 152 kilometers (94 miles) in diameter.This view of layering in the mound's lower formation covers an area about 950 meters (3,100 feet) wide

thumbnailImage.caption: Layers of rock exposed in the lower portion of a tall mound near the center of Gale Crater on Mars exhibit variations in layer thickness and range between dark and light tones. The crater's mound of layered material is over 4 kilometers (2.4 miles) high, making it more than twice as thick as the stack of rocks exposed in the Grand Canyon on Earth. Gale Crater is approximately 152 kilometers (94 miles) in diameter.This view of layering in the mound's lower formation covers an area about 950 meters (3,100 feet) wide

pictures.caption: Bright layered deposits on a plateau near Juventae Chasma
pictures.altText: Mars: Juventae Chasma in the Valles Marineris

image.caption: This view shows color variations in bright layered deposits on a plateau near Juventae Chasma in the Valles Marineris region of Mars. A brown mantle covers portions of the bright deposits. The view covers an area about 1.2 kilometers (three-fourths of a mile) across.
image.altText: Mars: Juventae Chasma in the Valles Marineris

thumbnailImage.caption: This view shows color variations in bright layered deposits on a plateau near Juventae Chasma in the Valles Marineris region of Mars. A brown mantle covers portions of the bright deposits. The view covers an area about 1.2 kilometers (three-fourths of a mile) across.
thumbnailImage.altText: Mars: Juventae Chasma in the Valles Marineris

pictures.caption: Synthesised, oblique view of the wall terraces of Mojave Crater
pictures.altText: Mars: Mojave Crater in the Xanthe Terra region

image.caption: A digital terrain model generated from a stereo pair of images provides this synthesized, oblique view of a portion of the wall terraces of Mojave Crater in the Xanthe Terra region of Mars. This view shows the ponding of material backed up behind massive wall-terrace blocks of bedrock. Hundreds of impact craters on Mars have similarly ponded features with pitted surfaces. These "pitted ponds" are thought to result when material melted by the crater-causing impacts is captured behind the wall terraces
image.altText: Mars: Mojave Crater in the Xanthe Terra region

thumbnailImage.caption: A digital terrain model generated from a stereo pair of images provides this synthesized, oblique view of a portion of the wall terraces of Mojave Crater in the Xanthe Terra region of Mars. This view shows the ponding of material backed up behind massive wall-terrace blocks of bedrock. Hundreds of impact craters on Mars have similarly ponded features with pitted surfaces. These "pitted ponds" are thought to result when material melted by the crater-causing impacts is captured behind the wall terraces
thumbnailImage.altText: Mars: Mojave Crater in the Xanthe Terra region

pictures.caption: Dunes of sandy materials trapped on the floors of a crater in Noachis Terra

image.caption: Dunes of sand-sized materials have been trapped on the floors of many Martian craters. This is one example, from a crater in Noachis Terra, west of the giant Hellas impact basin

thumbnailImage.caption: Dunes of sand-sized materials have been trapped on the floors of many Martian craters. This is one example, from a crater in Noachis Terra, west of the giant Hellas impact basin

pictures.caption: Layers in the lower portion of two neighbouring buttes within Noctis Labyrinthus

image.caption: Layers in the lower portion of two neighboring buttes within the Noctis Labyrinthus formation. Dune fields blanket the ground in the upper left of the image and a portion of the ground between the buttes. Exposures of brighter and darker materials are also visible in the portion of that area not covered by the dunes

thumbnailImage.caption: Layers in the lower portion of two neighboring buttes within the Noctis Labyrinthus formation. Dune fields blanket the ground in the upper left of the image and a portion of the ground between the buttes. Exposures of brighter and darker materials are also visible in the portion of that area not covered by the dunes

pictures.caption: Spider-like features carved in the south polar region by vaporising dry ice
pictures.altText: Mars: Spider-shaped features known as araneiform

image.caption: Spider-shaped features known as araneiform in the south polar region of Mars are carved by vaporizing dry ice in a dynamic seasonal process
image.altText: Mars: Spider-shaped features known as araneiform

thumbnailImage.caption: Spider-shaped features known as araneiform in the south polar region of Mars are carved by vaporizing dry ice in a dynamic seasonal process
thumbnailImage.altText: Mars: Spider-shaped features known as araneiform

draft.headline: Mars: Dunes, gullies and craters
draft.standfirst: The camera on Nasa's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter has recorded new images taken from April to early August 2009 as part of its ongoing study of the planet, which began in 2006
